text: Ruthka Lieblich (English: Ruth Lieblich; 1926 â€“ 1943), was a teenager from Andrychow who perished in the Auschwitz camp around 1943. She is known for her diary, in which she documented her life in a ghetto. Ruthka kept her diary from August 13, 1940, until December 28, 1942. Ruthka Lieblich's diary was published in Hebrew and English as "Ruthka: A Diary of War" in 1993. It was translated from Polish. The diary was translated and edited by Jehoshua and Anna Eibeshitz. title: Ruthka Lieblich
